comment: Sweet, peppery. Apples. Lighter than a high end, heavily-aged bourbon, but good sipping nonetheless.

Nose: sweet apple, ethanol 

Palate: sweet and apple without much depth or maturity 

Finish: short with apple and heavy ethanol

“When in Rome...”

I pick up the apple chips in the nose, appropriate maybe to its apple juice color.  Neat, I taste corn tapering to anise before a long tail of alcohol burn.  Adding a bit of water or maybe because it's been in the glass longer there is corn on the nose and a sweet oily mouth feel.  Like its color, the overall experience is one of lightness. A true maverick, there is no suggestion of bourbon or scotch. A nice whiskey to drink and savor.
Very light taste. Good for long sipping

Nose.  Salt water/shellfish?
Palate.  Spicy.  Young.  
Finish.  Short.
Nose was almost like cotton candy. Tasted a little more like a Scotch than a  Bourbon to me. A lot of depth and a warm, smoky finish. Nice.
